title: Inhame de Lagartixa (Cotyledon Umbilicus)
body: A small succulent plant with peltate-suborbicular basal leaves, long petiolate. This Crassulaceae is common on the walls and rocks in Monte, S. Martinho, Santo António, etc., and its juice has been recommended for epilepsy, leg ulcers, and wounds.

Monte: Location where the plant is common
S. Martinho: Location where the plant is common
Santo António: Location where the plant is common
